Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 1. "The sample complexity of our algorithm for linear regression with Massart noise is quantitatively higher, compared to the noiseless case."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The sample complexity of our algorithm for linear regression with Massart noise, is quantitatively higher;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 2. "Our work gives the *first polynomial sample and time* algorithm."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: Our work, gives the *first polynomial sample and time* algorithm;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 3. "The runtime of our algorithm depends on the bit complexity $b$ of the points."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The runtime of our algorithm, depends on the bit complexity $b$ of the points;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 4. "In our specific setting, we solve a linear program to perform exact recovery, which incurs a runtime polynomial in $\log(1/\epsilon)$, not $1/\epsilon$."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: In our specific setting, we solve a linear program to perform exact recovery, incurs a runtime polynomial in $\log(1/\epsilon)$, not $1/\epsilon$;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 5. "The sample complexity of our algorithms does not depend on the bit complexity, as a consequence of using radial isotropy."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The sample complexity of our algorithms, does not depend on the bit complexity;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 6. "This is an extremely mild condition that is satisfied by a wide range of distributions."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: This is an extremely mild condition, is satisfied by a wide range of distributions;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 7. "The central question of our paper is whether there exists realistic label noise models in which efficient learning is possible *without strong distributional assumptions*"
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The central question of our paper, exists realistic label noise models in which efficient learning is possible *without strong distributional assumptions*;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 8. "Thus, the use of radial
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: behaved distributions;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 9. "Computing a radial
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: isotropic transformation $A$, can be done in polynomial time as specified in Lemma 2.1.

7BlQMwp_44p.Document Title: Official Review of Paper7733 by Reviewer vpXo

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 1. "I haven't completely checked the proofs, however, the overall idea makes sense to me and is, in fact, quite interesting."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The overall idea of the paper, makes sense, quite interesting;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 2. "With respect to weaknesses, paper lacks proper discussion at some points which I have explained in the 'Main review' section."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The paper, lacks proper discussion at some points;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 3. "Also, author(s) have assumed a completely clean and noise
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: free except for the adversarial part;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 4. "Overall a well
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: written, some interesting theoretical achievements;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 5. "Author(s) seem to have a good grasp of existing literature in this area, but it hasn't been completely reflected in the Introduction section."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The introduction section, not completely reflecting the authors' grasp of existing literature;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 6. "The adversary described in Definition 1.1 does not match with the one that has been explained in Lines (117:119)."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The adversary in Definition 1.1, does not match the one explained in Lines (117:119);

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 7. "In Section 1.2, the transition from ReLU and linear regression in the presence of Massart noise to $\ell_0$ or $\ell_1$
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The transition in Section 1.2, not smooth.

7BlQMwp_44p.Document Title: Official Review of Paper7733 by Reviewer Dpt6

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 1. "One of the strong points if the paper is that it is very well
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: written and well organized.

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 2. "The ideas are presented clearly with intuitive explanations, and the proofs are rigorous."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The ideas and proofs, presented clearly with intuitive explanations and are rigorous.

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 3. "The authors are careful in evaluating the strengths/weaknesses of their work."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The authors, careful in evaluating the strengths/weaknesses of their work.

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 4. "The work seems to be built upon an established literature and the review of related works are informative."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The work, built upon an established literature and review of related works are informative.

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 5. "The paper consider a slightly weakened model, but leads to more generality in the underlying data distribution."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The model in the paper, slightly weakened but leads to more generality in the underlying data distribution.

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 6. "The result of the work is significantly different (stronger) from the closest comparisons ([32] and [10]), and the methods are designed specifically to address the limitation of those works."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The result of the work, significantly different and stronger from the closest comparisons, and the methods, designed specifically to address the limitations of those works.

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 7. "The generalization of the approach from linear to ReLU regressions are non
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: trivial in both technical analysis and algorithmic designs.

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 8. "As stated in the Originality section, the result of the work is significantly different (stronger) from the closest comparisons ([32] and [10]) and seems to extend existing works in a demonstrable way."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The result of the work, significantly different and stronger from the closest comparisons, and seems to extend existing works in a demonstrable way.

7BlQMwp_44p.Document Title: Official Review of Paper7733 by Reviewer 8NsY

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 1. "I feel the paper is well
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: written; Theoretical guarantee, having a few concerns;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 2. "The sample complexity for robust linear regression is suboptimal. In particular, even when the noise rate eta = 0, it is given by O(d^3) which is worse than that of noiseless regression."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: Sample complexity for robust linear regression, suboptimal;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 3. "It also seems unpleasant to have bit complexity dependence in running time."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: Bit complexity dependence in running time, unpleasant;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 4. "I cannot follow the assumption that $P( w \cdot x \geq 0 ) \geq \lambda$ for all w."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The assumption that $P( w \cdot x \geq 0 ) \geq \lambda$ for all w, hard to follow;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 5. "What is the computational cost to obtain a radial
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: isotropic transformation matrix A, unclear;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 6. "The distributional assumption is informally stated throughout. Can you provide a few examples that satisfy the condition, say Gaussian distributions or uniform distributions?"
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The distributional assumption, informally stated;

Annotated Judgements.Content Expression: 7. "My understanding is not being necessary, in which case the technical novelty appears vacuous."
Annotated Judgements.Sentiment Expression: The technical novelty, appears vacuous.
